info.title: CribNosh API
info.description: Personalized meal platform API with modern, glossy, culturally-aware design

get.description: Welcome endpoint that confirms the API is working and accessible

message.example: Welcome to the CribNosh API! The API is working.

post.description: Handle Stripe webhook events for payment processing and order updates

400.description: Bad request - missing signature or invalid payload

500.description: Internal server error during webhook processing

post.description: Handle Resend email service webhook events for email analytics and tracking

500.description: Internal server error or webhook secret not configured

x-webhook.description:
This endpoint handles Resend webhook events for email analytics:

**Supported Email Events:**
- `email.sent`: Email was sent successfully
- `email.delivered`: Email was delivered to recipient
- `email.delivery_delayed`: Email delivery was delayed
- `email.complained`: Recipient marked email as spam
- `email.bounced`: Email bounced (hard/soft bounce)
- `email.clicked`: Recipient clicked a link in the email
- `email.opened`: Recipient opened the email
- `email.unsubscribed`: Recipient unsubscribed
- `email.failed`: Email failed to send

**Supported Contact Events:**
- `contact.created`: New contact created
- `contact.updated`: Contact information updated
- `contact.deleted`: Contact deleted

**Supported Domain Events:**
- `domain.created`: New domain added
- `domain.updated`: Domain settings updated
- `domain.deleted`: Domain removed

**Webhook Security:**
- Requires valid Resend webhook signature
- Verifies webhook secret for authenticity
- Processes events asynchronously
- Records analytics data in Convex database

post.description:
Resets all rate limiting counters across all rate limiting systems.
In production, requires a secure 36-bit key for authorization.

**Rate Limiters Reset:**
- OTP Rate Limiter (15 min window)
- Verification Rate Limiter (5 min window) 
- General Auth Rate Limiter (1 min window)
- Sensitive Auth Rate Limiter (5 min window)
- Sensitive Rate Limiter (1 min window)
- Moderation Rate Limiter (1 min window)
- API Rate Limiter (15 min window)
- Middleware Auth Rate Limiter (15 min window)
- Webhook Rate Limiter (1 min window)
- Search Rate Limiter (1 min window)

**Use Cases:**
- API testing and development
- Clearing rate limits during automated testing
- Debugging rate limiting issues
- Performance testing without rate limit interference
- Production emergency rate limit reset (with key)

message.example: All rate limits have been reset
In production, a valid 36-bit security key is required

post.description: Handle Stripe webhook events for payment processing, refunds, and subscriptions

500.description: Internal server error or Stripe configuration error

x-webhook.description:
This endpoint handles Stripe webhook events:

**Supported Events:**
- `payment_intent.succeeded`: Marks orders as paid
- `payment_intent.payment_failed`: Notifies admins of failed payments
- `charge.refunded`: Marks orders as refunded
- `customer.subscription.created`: Updates user subscription status
- `customer.subscription.deleted`: Cancels user subscription
- `charge.dispute.created`: Notifies admins of payment disputes

**Webhook Security:**
- Requires valid Stripe signature header
- Verifies webhook secret for authenticity
- Processes events asynchronously

post.description: Add data to Notion synchronization queue for external data management

id.description: ID of the record to sync

200.description: Record added to sync queue successfully

x-integration.description:
This endpoint manages data synchronization with Notion:

**Supported Tables:**
- `waitlist`: Sync waitlist entries to Notion database

**Sync Process:**
- Adds records to background sync queue
- Processes synchronously to avoid blocking
- Handles retries and error recovery
- Maintains data consistency between systems

**Use Cases:**
- Customer waitlist management
- Lead tracking and CRM integration
- Data backup and external storage
- Team collaboration and reporting

x-integration.description:
This endpoint integrates with Mattermost for team notifications:

**Notification Types:**
- `test`: Send a test message to verify configuration
- `custom`: Send a custom message with specified content
- `system-health`: Send system health status notifications

**Configuration:**
- Requires either MATTERMOST_WEBHOOK_URL or MATTERMOST_BOT_TOKEN + MATTERMOST_SERVER_URL
- Uses MATTERMOST_CHANNEL_ID as default channel if not specified
- Supports both webhook and API-based messaging

**Use Cases:**
- Order notifications for kitchen staff
- System alerts for admin team
- Customer service notifications
- Development team updates

post.description: Retrieve detailed reports for live streaming sessions with optional filtering by status and channel. This endpoint provides comprehensive reporting data for administrative oversight and compliance monitoring.

takenBy.description: Admin user ID who took the action

get.description: Retrieve all live streaming sessions with optional filtering by status and chef. This endpoint provides comprehensive access to live session data for administrative monitoring and management.

parameters.description: Filter sessions by specific chef ID

parameters.description: Maximum number of sessions to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of sessions to skip for pagination

chefId.description: Chef ID who is hosting the session

channelName.description: Channel name for the live stream

description.example: Learn to make traditional Italian pasta from scratch

ordersPlaced.description: Number of orders placed during this session

chatEnabled.description: Whether chat is enabled for this session

post.description: Immediately terminate a live streaming session for administrative purposes. This endpoint allows administrators to end sessions due to policy violations, technical issues, or other administrative reasons. The action is logged for audit purposes.

channelName.description: Channel name or session ID to terminate

reason.description: Administrative reason for ending the session

adminId.description: Admin user ID performing the action (auto-populated from auth)

notifyChef.description: Whether to notify the chef about the session termination

notifyViewers.description: Whether to notify viewers about the session termination

chefId.description: Chef ID whose session was terminated

adminId.description: Admin ID who performed the termination

finalViewerCount.description: Number of viewers when session was terminated

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid channel name

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

404.description: Live session not found or already ended

post.description: Process user emotions and context to provide personalized meal recommendations

data.description: Empty object on success (processing is asynchronous)

x-ai-features.description:
This endpoint powers CribNosh's AI-driven recommendation system:

**Context Aggregation:**
- Merges frontend user input with backend user data
- Fetches nearby chef specialties based on location
- Considers user's historical preferences and behavior

**Emotional Analysis:**
- Processes user's current emotional state
- Maps emotions to appropriate meal types and cuisines
- Considers time of day and occasion context

**Personalization:**
- Takes into account dietary restrictions and allergies
- Considers budget and cooking time constraints
- Learns from user's past orders and ratings

**Location Intelligence:**
- Finds nearby chefs within 10km radius
- Considers local cuisine availability
- Factors in delivery time and logistics

**AI Processing:**
- Runs inference using aggregated context
- Generates personalized meal recommendations
- Updates user preference models

403.description: Forbidden - only admins can access this endpoint

post.description: Perform sentiment analysis on multiple reviews within a date range using AI models. This endpoint processes reviews and updates them with sentiment data for better insights and moderation.

model.description: AI model to use for sentiment analysis

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid date format

403.description: Forbidden - only admins can perform batch sentiment analysis

500.description: Internal server error or emotions engine failure

post.description: Approve or reject a customer review for publication. This endpoint allows administrators to moderate reviews and add approval notes. Changes are logged for audit purposes.

parameters.name: review_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the review to approve/reject

status.description: New moderation status for the review

approvalNotes.description: Optional notes from the admin about the approval decision

400.description: Bad request - missing review_id or status

403.description: Forbidden - only admins can approve/reject reviews

put.description: Update the approval status of a review. This is an alias for the POST endpoint with identical functionality.

parameters.name: review_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the review to update

status.description: New moderation status for the review

approvalNotes.description: Optional notes from the admin about the approval decision

400.description: Bad request - missing review_id or status

403.description: Forbidden - only admins can update review status

get.description: Retrieve user growth analytics showing daily signup trends over the last 7 days. This endpoint provides insights into user acquisition patterns and growth metrics for administrative reporting.

labels.description: Array of date labels for the last 7 days (YYYY-MM-DD format)

signups.description: Array of daily signup counts corresponding to the labels

total.description: Total number of users in the system

generatedAt.description: Timestamp when the report was generated

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

post.description: Broadcast real-time events to all connected clients through Convex subscriptions. This endpoint allows administrators to send system-wide notifications, updates, or announcements to all active users in real-time.

event.description: Event type identifier for real-time broadcasting

example.title: System Maintenance
example.message: Scheduled maintenance will begin in 30 minutes

expiresAt.description: Optional expiration time for the broadcast

changeId.description: Unique identifier for the broadcast event

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when event was broadcasted

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

get.description: Retrieve all pending items requiring admin approval including users, chefs, and dishes

pendingUsers.description: Array of users with pending status

pendingChefs.description: Array of chefs with pending approval

description.example: Classic Italian pasta dish

chefId.description: Chef ID who created the dish

403.description: Forbidden - only admins can access this endpoint

get.description: Retrieve detailed refund eligibility information for orders. This endpoint provides comprehensive data about which orders are eligible for refunds, including time windows, reasons for ineligibility, and admin override capabilities.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of orders to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of orders to skip for pagination

orders.description: Array of orders with refund eligibility information

isRefundable.description: Whether the order is currently refundable

isEligible.description: Whether order is eligible for refund

overrideReason.description: Reason why override is possible/not possible

400.description: Bad request - invalid parameters or limit exceeded

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

post.description: Mark an order as refundable and optionally extend the refund window. This endpoint allows administrators to override refund eligibility for orders that may have been incorrectly marked as non-refundable or to extend refund windows for customer service purposes.

orderId.description: Unique identifier of the order to mark as refundable

reason.description: Reason for marking the order as refundable

description.description: Detailed description of why the order is being marked as refundable
description.example: Customer provided valid documentation for refund request

extendWindow.description: Whether to extend the refund window beyond the standard 24 hours

newWindowHours.description: New refund window duration in hours (1-168 hours)

description.example: Customer provided valid documentation for refund request

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or order already refundable

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

post.description: Mark an order as non-refundable, revoking its refund eligibility. This endpoint allows administrators to prevent refunds for orders that violate terms of service, involve fraud, or for other business policy reasons. Can override the standard 24-hour refund window.

orderId.description: Unique identifier of the order to mark as non-refundable

reason.description: Reason for marking the order as non-refundable

description.description: Detailed description of why the order is being marked as non-refundable
description.example: Payment method flagged as fraudulent by payment processor

effectiveImmediately.description: Whether to revoke refund eligibility immediately, overriding the 24-hour window

description.example: Payment method flagged as fraudulent by payment processor

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields, order already non-refundable, or still within refund window

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

post.description: Manage refund eligibility for multiple orders in bulk (admin only)

orders.description: Array of order refund eligibility operations

action.description: Action to perform on the order

description.example: Customer requested immediate refund ineligibility

newWindowHours.description: New refund window in hours (for extend_window action)

effectiveImmediately.description: Whether to apply immediately (for mark_non_refundable action)

globalReason.description: Global reason applied to all orders if not specified individually

globalDescription.description: Global description applied to all orders if not specified individually

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

get.description: Retrieve the current authenticated admin user's profile information

401.description: Unauthorized - no session token or invalid token

403.description: Forbidden - user is not an admin

get.description: Export system logs in JSON or CSV format with optional filtering. This endpoint allows administrators to download logs for analysis, compliance, or debugging purposes. The export action is logged for audit purposes.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Filter logs by admin user ID

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start timestamp for log filtering (Unix timestamp)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End timestamp for log filtering (Unix timestamp)

adminId.description: Admin user ID who performed the action

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

get.description: Retrieve system logs for administrative monitoring and debugging. This endpoint provides access to application logs, error logs, and system events with pagination support. Only accessible by administrators.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of log entries to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of log entries to skip for pagination

total.description: Total number of log entries available

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

post.description: Log out admin users by clearing their session cookies. This endpoint invalidates the admin session and removes authentication cookies.

schema.example: convex-auth-token=; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=Lax; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT

post.description: Authenticate admin users and create session tokens

400.description: Validation error - missing required fields or invalid JSON

401.description: Unauthorized - invalid credentials or not an admin

get.description: Retrieve logs from the AI emotions engine with optional filtering

403.description: Forbidden - Admin access required

get.description: Retrieve email configuration settings for templates, automations, branding, delivery, analytics, and compliance. Supports filtering by category and specific configuration ID.

config.description: Single configuration object (when id parameter provided)

configs.description: Array of configuration objects (when category parameter provided or all configs)

400.description: Bad request - invalid category or missing required parameters

post.description: Create or update email configuration settings. This endpoint allows administrators to manage email templates, automations, branding, delivery settings, analytics, and compliance configurations.

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid category

put.description: Update email configuration with validation. This endpoint performs validation checks before updating configurations and returns warnings for potential issues.

example: Template contains placeholder that may not be replaced

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields, invalid category, or validation failed

delete.description: Delete email configuration. Note that branding, delivery, analytics, and compliance configurations cannot be deleted and can only be updated.

400.description: Bad request - missing required parameters or configuration type cannot be deleted

post.description: Validate email templates or automation configurations before saving
Import email templates or automation configurations from a JSON file

400.description: Validation error - Missing file/category or invalid JSON

get.description: Export email templates and automation configurations in JSON or YAML format

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Configuration category to export (e.g., templates, automations)

400.description: Validation error - Missing category or invalid format

chefId.description: Chef ID who created the dish

description.example: Classic Italian pasta with eggs, cheese, and pancetta

chefId.description: Chef ID who created the dish

description.example: Classic Italian pasta with eggs, cheese, and pancetta

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

patch.description: Partially update a dish's information. Only provided fields will be updated.

description.example: Premium Italian pasta with organic eggs, aged parmesan, and artisanal pancetta

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

put.description: Completely replace a dish's information with new data.

description.example: Classic Italian pasta with eggs, cheese, and pancetta

chefId.description: Chef ID who created the dish

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

delete.description: Permanently delete a dish from the system. This action cannot be undone.

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

post.description: Submit an administrative review for a specific dish, including approval/rejection status and optional notes. This endpoint is used for quality control and content moderation of chef-created dishes.

parameters.name: dish_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the dish to review

notes.description: Optional administrative notes about the review
notes.example: Dish meets all quality standards. Approved for public listing.

issues.description: List of issues found during review (if any)

reviewerComments.description: Internal reviewer comments (not visible to chef)
reviewerComments.example: Chef has good technique, just needs better presentation

reviewId.description: ID of the created review record

reviewerId.description: Admin user ID who performed the review

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid data

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required

put.description: Update an existing administrative review for a dish. This endpoint allows modifying review status, notes, or other review details.

parameters.name: dish_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the dish whose review to update

notes.example: Updated: Please improve image quality and add more detailed description.

reviewerComments.example: Chef needs to improve presentation skills

reviewId.description: ID of the updated review record

reviewerId.description: Admin user ID who updated the review

400.description: Bad request - missing dish_id or invalid data

403.description: Forbidden - admin access required
